tier_1_determinative.key_facts: The appellant, Abdul @ Aslam Salim Shaikh, was convicted under sections 399 and 402 of IPC and section 4 read with section 25 of the Arms Act. No weapon was found in his possession, and there was no evidence of a Notification by the Central Government under Section 4 of the Arms Act.

tier_2_material.material_facts: The prosecution's case was based on information received by Police Constable Rane about a planned dacoity in Trimurti Market, Zhaveri Bazar. Four accused, including the appellant, were arrested, but the appellant was not found with any weapon.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Abdul @ Aslam Salim Shaikh vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Sections 399, 402 of IPC and Section 4 r/w Section 25 of the Arms Act

residual_details.additional_facts: The appellant challenged the conviction and sentence, arguing that the trial court did not properly scrutinize the evidence and that the fine should be reduced. The appellant was in custody since 28th March 2001 and was likely to be released on 1st May 2007 after completing the sentence.
